author: potuz
content: Hi, for the merge beacon API, the endpoints to get the blocks, will they be something like `eth/v2/beacon/blocks` and return a block with a merge `version` or will they be `v3`?

author: ajsutton
content: We should be able to do them with the v2 apis since the version field lets us specify what the block type is.  At least that was the aim of the v2 design.

author: potuz
content: yeah that's why I'm asking, I have no way currently of retrieving the blocks from my node in pithos, so I'm trying to write the endpoint

author: potuz
content: I also think v2 would be more reasonable

author: ajsutton
content: I don't see any reason we wouldn't be able to just say version: merge and then the block body would just have the extra execution_payload field I think.

author: jgm
content: Possibly not the perfect time to do it, but are we going to name the merge hard fork? Shouldn't take long to pick some star names and have a vote.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> I'm also interested in naming the merge beacon chain upgrade.
I find it hard to communicate the difference between:
1. When the Beacon Chain undergoes the fork/upgrade at some specified epoch
2. When the first terminal-block-successor is included in the beacon chain
If we could name (1), then we could call that whatever the star name is. Then, we could call point (2) "the merge". I think (2) is probably what the community calls "the merge", i assume they don't care about us upgrading beacon chain data structures, etc.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> Currently calling it
1. Merge fork
2. Transition process
Fine with giving (1) a name though
